generif.text: Claudin 5 is transiently expressed during the development of the retinal pigment epithelium.

data for the first time explain how two claudins hold onto each other and constrict the paracellular space. The intermolecular interface includes aromatic (F147, Y148, Y158) and hydrophilic (Q156, E159) residues

name: claudin 5
other_names: transmembrane protein deleted in velocardiofacial syndrome

kegg.name: Pathogenic Escherichia coli infection - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: RUNX1 regulates expression of components of tight junctions

wikipathways.name: Epithelial to mesenchymal transition in colorectal cancer

summary: This gene encodes a member of the claudin family. Claudins are integral membrane proteins and components of tight junction strands. Tight junction strands serve as a physical barrier to prevent solutes and water from passing freely through the paracellular space between epithelial or endothelial cell sheets. Mutations in this gene have been found in patients with velocardiofacial syndrome. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding distinct isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, May 2018].
